result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A Doverspike was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Todd A Doverspike is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Todd A Doverspike was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: COC collect from bond already posted.
Huber allowed for treatment and work
No contact with Rhonda Pfenning, DOB 5/22/65.  Defendant is not eligible to vote.  Defendant cannot possess firearms.
Defendant shall successfully complete treatment court in Dunn County.

timeConds.notes:
30 days to be served immediately, sentence to commence forthwith.  150 days conditional jail held in abeyance to be used at discretion of Probation Officer as a condition of probation.
Concurrent with: 15CF243, Ct. 7, but consecutive to any other terms currently being served.

Defendant, Todd A Doverspike, in custody, appeared with Attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(9:40)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - have resolution - plea to Ct 2 15CF44  as repeater - dismiss balance - plea to Ct 7 15CF243 as repeater - remaining charges dismiss and 15CF75

Deft - 15CF44 Ct 2 - as repeater; 2nd and subsequent removed - pleads  guilty - waives rights & jury trial
Deft - 15CF243 Ct 7 - as repeater; pleads guilty - waives rights & jury trial

State recommends - deft currently serving a 12 months sentence in Pepin Co. - placed on 3 yrs prob - 30 days jail up front in Dunn consecutive - 180 days imposed and stayed for probation agent in both files concurrent - successfully complete treatment court in Dunn Co - did eval with J. Brantner - also request imposed and stayed prison sentence 3 yrs IS, 4 yrs ES, nc with Rhonda Pfenning 5/22/65 and court costs

Randtke - argues sentence - requests deft be eligible for challenge incarc. & substance abuse
Deft - addresses the court

COURT:  15CF44 Ct 2 as repeater (removing second and subsequent) plea voluntary - finds deft guilty
15CF243 Ct 7 - plea voluntary - finds deft guilty
w/held sentence 3 yrs probation on each concurrent to each
$268 cc on each
$250 dna surchg on each

successfully complete treatment court in Dunn Co
